result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:59 PM . Defendant Ricardo Esqueda in court.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Ricardo Esqueda.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin.   Cases 22CF18 and 22CF34.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Anne Renc
Adjourned initial appearance on March 21, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

02:18 PM Defendant Ricardo Esqueda in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian J Pfeil appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions the Defendant if he will be getting an attorney.  Defendant states he has lost his job and will need to reapply to the public defender office.  No objections. Matter rescheduled.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Initial Appearance set for February 7, 2022 @ 1:30 p.m. in Br 2

Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
Maintain absolute sobriety, if and when driving 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment.

1:09 p.m.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedididah Dodge appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Taylor Soule appears in court for defendant. 

ADA Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officers.
PBT .15 (to be handled by the city of stevens point)
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $2,000 signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule does not have any objections as to bond. 
Court adopts the requested signature bond of $2,000 with conditions as stated on the record.

Initial Appearance scheduled for:  February 7, 2022  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
